content.en:
# Upload Media

The media library is your central storage location for all files you use in your PR campaigns: press images, logos, PDFs, videos, and more. Here you'll learn how to upload, organize, and later use files in projects.

## Why a Central Media Library?

Instead of uploading the same files for each press release, you store them centrally once and can reuse them as many times as you want. This saves time and ensures you're always using the latest versions.

## Upload Single File

### Step 1: Open Media Library

Navigate via the main navigation to **Library ‚Üí Media**. Here you'll see all your files and folders.

[Screenshot: Navigation to media library]

### Step 2: Open Upload Dialog

Click the **"Upload"** button in the top right. A dialog opens where you can select files.

[Screenshot: Upload button in toolbar]

### Step 3: Select File

Click **"Choose Files"** or drag a file directly via drag & drop into the marked area.

**Supported formats:**
- **Images:** JPG, PNG, GIF, WebP
- **Videos:** MP4, MOV
- **Documents:** PDF, DOC, DOCX

**Maximum file size:** 10 MB per file

[Screenshot: Drag & drop area in upload dialog]

### Step 4: Start Upload

After selecting one or more files, you'll see a preview with:
- Filename
- File size
- Upload progress (during upload)

Click **"Upload"** to start the upload. You'll see in real-time how far each file has been uploaded.

[Screenshot: Upload progress with percentage]

> **Tip:** You can keep the dialog open or close it during upload ‚Äì the upload continues in the background.

## Upload Multiple Files Simultaneously

### Bulk Upload

You can upload up to **25 files simultaneously**. The system automatically processes them in batches of 5 files in parallel to achieve the best possible upload speed.

**How to:**
1. Click "Choose Files" in the upload dialog
2. Hold **Ctrl** (Windows) or **Cmd** (Mac) and select multiple files
3. Or drag multiple files simultaneously via drag & drop into the area

Each file shows its own progress. If an upload fails, it's automatically retried up to 3 times.

[Screenshot: Multiple files with individual progress]

> **Tip:** For very large numbers of files, we recommend uploading them in groups of 10-15 files for better overview.

## Upload Files to Folders

### Upload to Existing Folder

To upload files directly into a specific folder:

1. Open the desired folder by clicking on the folder card
2. Click **"Upload"**
3. In the upload dialog you'll see a blue notice at the top: "Target folder: [Folder name]"
4. Select your files ‚Äì they'll automatically be saved in the current folder

[Screenshot: Upload dialog with target folder display]

### Create Folder Structure

Before uploading large amounts of files, you should think about a sensible folder structure:

**Example structure:**
```
üìÅ Logos
  üìÅ Clients
    üìÅ Client A
    üìÅ Client B
  üìÅ Own Brand
üìÅ Press Images
  üìÅ 2025
    üìÅ Q1
    üìÅ Q2
  üìÅ 2024
üìÅ Documents
  üìÅ Factsheets
  üìÅ Whitepapers
```

To create a new folder, click **"New Folder"** and give it a meaningful name.

## Drag & Drop Directly into Folders

### Organize Files via Drag & Drop

You can also move files directly into folders via drag & drop:

1. Click on a file and hold the mouse button
2. Drag the file over a folder ‚Äì it will be outlined in blue
3. Release the mouse button ‚Äì the file will be moved

**Move multiple files:**
- Hold **Ctrl** (Windows) or **Cmd** (Mac) and click multiple files
- Drag one of the selected files ‚Äì all marked files will be moved

[Screenshot: Drag & drop into folder with blue outline]

> **Tip:** You can also move folders into other folders to build a hierarchy.

## After Upload: Edit Files

### Add Metadata

After upload, you should add important information to your files:

1. Click the three dots (‚ãÆ) on a file
2. Select **"Edit Details"**
3. Add:
   - **Description:** What is the file for?
   - **Tags:** Keywords for search (e.g. "logo", "press-image", "q1-2025")
   - **Notes:** Internal remarks

[Screenshot: Asset details modal with metadata fields]

Good descriptions and tags help you quickly find files later ‚Äì especially when you have hundreds of files.

## Use Files in Projects

### Select from Media Library

When creating a press release in a project, you can select directly from the media library:

1. Go to **Projects ‚Üí [Your Project] ‚Üí Press Release**
2. In the "Media Attachments" section, click **"From Library"**
3. Select the desired files
4. They'll automatically be linked to the press release

Advantage: The files remain stored in the media library and can be reused in multiple projects.

## Common Issues

**Upload fails ‚Äì "File too large"**

Maximum file size is 10 MB. Compress large images with tools like TinyPNG or compress videos.

**File format not supported**

Only the formats mentioned above are accepted. Convert your file to a supported format.

**Upload stuck at 0%**

Check your internet connection. If the problem persists, reload the page and try again.

**"No permission to upload"**

Only team members with the role "Admin" or "Member" can upload files. Contact your team admin.

## Best Practices

### Use Meaningful Filenames

Use descriptive filenames that are understandable even without preview:

‚úÖ **Good:** `client-a-logo-2025.png`, `press-image-product-launch-q1.jpg`

‚ùå **Bad:** `IMG_1234.jpg`, `Untitled-1.png`

### Plan Folder Structure

Think about a logical structure before uploading:
- By **Client** (if you're an agency)
- By **Project** (for internal teams)
- By **Period** (2024, 2025, Q1, Q2)
- By **File Type** (Logos, Press Images, Documents)

### Clean Up Regularly

Delete old, no longer needed files to save storage space and maintain overview.

### Use Tags Consistently

Assign consistent tags for similar files:
- `logo`
- `press-image`
- `campaign-2025`
- `q1`, `q2`, `q3`, `q4`

This way you'll find files lightning-fast later via search.

## Next Steps

- [Organize Media](/support/en/bibliothek/medien-organisieren) ‚Äì Use folders, tags and search
- [Share Media](/support/en/bibliothek/medien-teilen) ‚Äì Create share links for journalists
- [Use Media in Projects](/support/en/projekte/medien-anhaenge-auswaehlen) ‚Äì Embed files in press releases
